end the first 16 stitches are for the thumb the rest are for the hand the thumb knit the first 16 stitches of the round and leave the remaining 38 stitches on a needle holder or use the smaller circular needle to hold them using the backward loop method cast on two more stitches and divide your stitches into two sets of nine on one circular needle or three sets of six double pointed needles with the new stitches at the end of the round work 21 rounds in the padded stitch pattern round 1 *sl 1 k1 repeat from * to end round 2 knit if you are using the magic loop method the two sets of nine stitches won t be worked identically the first set will start with a slipped stitch and the second with a knit to check that 21 rounds gives you the right length of thumb for your hand try the mitten on this is much easier if you re using a circular needle the thumb should come about half way up your thumb nail if not add or subtract rounds here as necessary next round *k1 k2tog repeat from * to end 12 sts next round knit next round *k2tog repeat from * to end 6 sts cut the yarn thread it through the remaining six stitches pull the end firmly through to the wrong side of the thumb and darn it in the hand pick up and knit eight stitches from the base of the thumb don t work into the loose slipped strands near the edge and then knit the rest of the stitches from the holder this will give you 46 stitches divide them so that you have 24 stitches on the first half of the needle and 22 on the second if using double pointed needles i would suggest dividing the stitches between four needles keeping that break after the first 24 round 1 sl 1 k2 sl 1 k1 twice k1 *sl 1 k1 repeat from * to end round 2 ssk k4 k2tog k to end 44 sts now you can carry on in padded stitch for the main part of the hand round 1 *sl 1 k1 repeat from * to end round 2 knit padded stitch inside and out the padded stitch looks like a rib on the right side but the slipped stitches give that extra thickness inside the mitten work 30 rounds like this or until your mitten reaches the top of the little finger when tried on you might like to compare the rough measurement of your knitting from the base of the thumb to
